body:
@gfr thanks a lot for reporting issues back to us!

we need some more information to properly support you with your issue!

can i ask you to follow our guidelines for submitting bugs as described here: https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/contributing.md

thanks a lot!

### expected behaviour
home screen should appear

### actual behaviour
whitepage/404-error

### steps to reproduce
1. upgrade owncloud from 5.0.12 to 5.0.13
2. open owncloud/index.php


### server configuration
operating system:
ubuntu 13.10
web server: 
apache 2.4
database:
mysql 5.5.34 
php version:
php 5.5.3
owncloud version:
5.0.13

### client configuration
browser: firefox

operating system:
kubuntu

### logs
#### web server error log
nothing to see related to owncloud

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
nothing to see

did you only upgrade owncloud or also updated apache / your apache config ?
we've tested upgrading from 5.0.12 to 5.0.13 many times and it worked fine.

can you please add 'loglevel' => '0', in config.php and add a line with define('debug', 1); at the end, then run the migration again ?

this should hopefully output more useful info in the log.

i've updated to apache 2.4 a few days before the upgrade to oc 5.0.13. i'll test the migration again the next days. personally i don't think that the problem is the migration because during the process was no error.

has anybody a running owncloud 5.0.13 with apache 2.4?

i'm not sure but the issue you're having seems to be an env issue. i'm not familiar with apache 2.4 or the differences between both versions. can you check whether the apache 2 changes for owncloud are still there and correct ?
@pvince81 which apache 2 changes do you mean? do you mean the .htaccess-file?

usually when you install owncloud the manual tells you to check these: http://doc.owncloud.org/server/6.0/admin_manual/installation/installation_source.html#enable-htaccess-and-mod-rewrite-if-running-apache

can you check that it's still correct or whether the upgrade to apache 2.4 has changed something / reset it back ?

can you check what version is in config.php before and after the migration ?
these errors are really weird.

cc @karlitschek

@gfr  most likely you need to refresh apc cache. this line gives a hint that it wasn't cleared automatically:

        {"app":"php","message":"undefined index: cache_list at \/var\/www\/owncloud-new\/lib\/cache\/apc.php#49","level":2,"time":"2013-11-18t13:58:42+00:00"}
